name: Acadia National Park
funFact: Acadia offers the highest point on the U.S. Atlantic coast at Cadillac Mountain.
description: Features coastal landscapes and rocky shorelines.

name: Arches National Park
funFact: Arches National Park has over 2,000 natural stone arches.
description: Known for its natural arches and unique rock formations.

name: Badlands National Park
funFact: Badlands features some of the most eroded and colorful landscapes in the U.S.
description: Known for its rugged terrain and dramatic landscapes.

name: Big Bend National Park
funFact: Big Bend is named for the sharp bend in the Rio Grande river.
description: Features desert landscapes and the Rio Grande river.

name: Biscayne National Park
funFact: Biscayne protects one of the largest marine parks in the U.S.
description: Known for its coral reefs and underwater landscapes.

name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
funFact: The Black Canyon has some of the steepest cliffs in North America.
description: Features dramatic and deep canyon views.

name: Bryce Canyon National Park
funFact: Bryce Canyon is known for its unique hoodoo rock formations.
description: Famous for its colorful rock spires and amphitheaters.

name: Canyonlands National Park
funFact: Canyonlands features stunning canyons and unique rock formations.
description: Known for its canyons carved by the Colorado River.

name: Capitol Reef National Park
funFact: Capitol Reef features a unique water pocket fold in the landscape.
description: Known for its unique rock formations and historic fruit orchards.

name: Carlsbad Caverns National Park
funFact: Carlsbad Caverns contains over 119 caves formed by sulfuric acid dissolution.
description: Features extensive cave systems and underground formations.

name: Channel Islands National Park
funFact: Channel Islands is known for its diverse marine life and island ecosystems.
description: Offers rugged island landscapes and marine life.

name: Congaree National Park
funFact: Congaree is known for its old-growth bottomland hardwood forest.
description: Features rich biodiversity and large floodplain forest.

name: Crater Lake National Park
funFact: Crater Lake is the deepest lake in the U.S.
description: Known for its stunning blue lake and volcanic caldera.

name: Cuyahoga Valley National Park
funFact: Cuyahoga Valley features the scenic Cuyahoga River and picturesque waterfalls.
description: Known for its river valleys and beautiful waterfalls.

name: Death Valley National Park
funFact: Death Valley is the hottest and driest national park in the U.S.
description: Features desert landscapes and extreme temperatures.

name: Denali National Park
funFact: Denali is home to North America's highest peak, standing at 20,310 feet.
description: Features towering mountains and expansive wilderness.

name: Dry Tortugas National Park
funFact: Dry Tortugas is known for its remote location and historic Fort Jefferson.
description: Features coral reefs and historic fortifications.

name: Everglades National Park
funFact: Everglades is home to diverse wildlife including alligators and panthers.
description: Known for its unique wetlands and rich biodiversity.

name: Gates of the Arctic National Park
funFact: Gates of the Arctic is one of the most remote and untouched national parks.
description: Features expansive wilderness and Arctic landscapes.

name: Gateway Arch National Park
funFact: Gateway Arch is a symbol of the westward expansion of the United States.
description: Known for its iconic arch and historical significance.

name: Glacier Bay National Park
funFact: Glacier Bay features dramatic fjords and active glaciers.
description: Known for its stunning glaciers and marine wildlife.

name: Glacier National Park
funFact: Glacier National Park is known for its rugged mountains and stunning scenery.
description: Features alpine landscapes and diverse ecosystems.

name: Grand Canyon National Park
funFact: Grand Canyon is one of the seven natural wonders of the world.
description: Known for its immense and visually overwhelming canyon.

name: Grand Teton National Park
funFact: Grand Teton is known for its dramatic mountain peaks and alpine lakes.
description: Features rugged mountain scenery and beautiful lakes.

name: Great Basin National Park
funFact: Great Basin features unique cave formations and starry night skies.
description: Known for its caves and diverse ecological zones.

name: Great Sand Dunes National Park
funFact: Great Sand Dunes has the tallest sand dunes in North America.

name: Great Smoky Mountains National Park
funFact: Great Smoky Mountains is known for its mist-covered mountains and rich biodiversity.

name: Guadalupe Mountains National Park
funFact: Guadalupe Mountains includes the highest peak in Texas.
description: Known for its mountainous terrain and desert landscapes.

name: Haleakalā National Park
funFact: Haleakalā is home to one of the world's largest dormant volcanoes.
description: Features volcanic landscapes and stunning sunrises.

name: Hawai’i Volcanoes National Park
funFact: Hawai’i Volcanoes is known for its active volcanoes, including Kilauea.

name: Hot Springs National Park
funFact: Hot Springs is famous for its natural hot springs and historic bathhouses.

name: Indiana Dunes National Park

name: Isle Royale National Park
funFact: Isle Royale is an isolated island park with rich wildlife and wilderness.

name: Joshua Tree National Park
funFact: Joshua Tree is known for its unique desert flora and striking rock formations.

name: Katmai National Park

name: Kenai Fjords National Park
funFact: Kenai Fjords features dramatic fjords and glaciers.

name: Kings Canyon National Park
funFact: Kings Canyon features deep valleys and high granite cliffs.

name: Kobuk Valley National Park

name: Lake Clark National Park
funFact: Lake Clark features volcanic landscapes and pristine lakes.

name: Mammoth Cave National Park
funFact: Mammoth Cave is the longest cave system in the world.

name: Mesa Verde National Park

name: Mount Rainier National Park
funFact: Mount Rainier is an active volcano and the highest peak in Washington state.

name: National Park of American Samoa
funFact: The National Park of American Samoa is one of the few tropical rainforests in the U.S. park system.

name: New River Gorge National Park
funFact: New River Gorge is known for its impressive gorge and outdoor recreation opportunities.

funFact: Pinnacles features unique rock spires and cave formations.

name: Redwood National Park
funFact: Redwood is home to the tallest trees on earth.

name: Rocky Mountain National Park
funFact: Rocky Mountain National Park offers stunning alpine views and wildlife.

name: Saguaro National Park
funFact: Saguaro is known for its giant saguaro cacti, a symbol of the American Southwest.

name: Sequoia National Park
funFact: Sequoia is home to the largest trees by volume, including General Sherman Tree.

name: Wind Cave National Park
funFact: Wind Cave is known for its unique cave formations and underground passages.

name: Wrangell-St. Elias National Park
funFact: Wrangell-St. Elias is the largest national park in the U.S., with vast glaciers and mountains.

funFact: Yosemite is famous for its stunning granite cliffs and waterfalls.

name: Zion National Park
